meanings.definition: A small, conical pile of hay stacked in a field.
meanings.sent1: The farmer gathered the haycocks to protect the hay from the rain.
meanings.sent2: The horses happily nibbled on the sweet haycocks in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to climb one of the haycocks but ended up rolling down instead.
meanings.sent4: The golden haycocks in the field glowed in the setting sun like small mountains.
meanings.sent5: The children played hide-and-seek around the haycocks, their laughter echoing in the open space.

meanings.definition: To stack hay into small, conical piles in a field.
meanings.sent1: The farmers haycocked the freshly cut hay to dry it out before storing it.
meanings.sent2: She haycocks the hay neatly to ensure proper ventilation and drying.
meanings.sent3: The dog thought it was a game and started to haycock the hay all over the field.
meanings.sent4: The workers haycocked the hay with precision, creating a beautiful pattern in the field.
meanings.sent5: As the sun rose, the farmers began to haycock the hay, their movements synchronized and efficient.
